TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataSourceCacheDurationConverter extends System.ComponentModel.Int32Converter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert 32-bit signed integer objects to and from data source control cache duration representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ASP.NET data source controls that support caching typically provide a `CacheDuration` property that you can set to the number of seconds that the control caches data. The value 0 represents "Infinite" in these caching contexts, and the DataSourceCacheDurationConverter class takes care of this explicit conversion.
Page developers do not use the DataSourceCacheDurationConverter class. Control developers who are developing data source controls that support caching use this type converter along with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> attribute to decorate a property that represents a cache duration setting of a custom data source control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how you can decorate a property on a data source control that supports caching with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> attribute. In this example, the data source control supports caching semantics and exposes three properties modeled after other ASP.NET data source controls: `EnableCaching`, `CacheDuration`, and `CacheExpirationPolicy`. The `CacheDuration` property uses the DataSourceCacheDurationConverter type converter.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.DataSourceCacheDurationConverter#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/t-system.web.ui.datasour_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.DataSourceCacheDurationConverter#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/t-system.web.ui.datasour_2_1.vb)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCacheDurationConverter> class explicitly handles `string` types. Otherwise, it calls on its base class, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Int32Converter>, to make the determination.

Docs.value: if this converter can perform the operation; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCacheDurationConverter> explicitly handles conversion to `string` and <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.InstanceDescriptor> types. Otherwise, it calls on its base class, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Int32Converter>, to make the determination.

Docs.value: if this converter can perform the operation; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public override object ConvertFrom (System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance object ConvertFrom(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture, object value) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
A <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> that specifies the culture in which to represent the number.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified object to an <xref:System.Int32> object.
Docs.returns: An object that represents the converted value. If is passed in the value parameter, is returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ConvertFrom method converts an <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> string or the string "Infinite" to the value 0. Other values are handled by the base class, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Int32Converter>.

Docs.value: An object that represents the converted value. If is passed in the value parameter, is returned.

The type to convert the object to.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The ConvertTo method converts a valid value of 0 to the string "Infinite". Other values are handled by the base class, <xref:System.ComponentModel.Int32Converter>.

Docs.value: An object that represents the converted value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool GetStandardValuesExclusive(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Specifies whether the collection of standard values returned from the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCacheDurationConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method is an exclusive list, using the specified context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCacheDurationConverter> class always returns `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection> collection returned from the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCacheDurationConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method is not an exhaustive list of possible values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool GetStandardValuesSupported(class System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: An that provides a format context.
Docs.summary: Specifies whether the object supports a standard set of values that can be picked from a list, using the specified context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCacheDurationConverter> object always returns `true` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceCacheDurationConverter.GetStandardValues%2A> method should be called to find a common set of values the converter supports.
